decks.notes: The main theme of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficient creature plays and burn spells. The deck utilizes cards like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher to provide early aggression, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Thraben Inspector and Mulldrifter. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to clear the opponent's board and ensure a favorable battlefield. The mana base consists of snow-covered lands and artifact mana fixing to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient creatures like Chittering Rats and Gray Merchant of Asphodel. The deck also includes removal spells like Chainer's Edict and Disfigure to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The card advantage provided by Phyrexian Rager and Sign in Blood helps to maintain momentum. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Glint Hawk and Seeker of the Way, supported by cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, the deck looks to quickly establish board presence and deal consistent damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card advantage sources like Thraben Inspector and Prophetic Prism to maintain hand advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Palace Sentinels allows the deck to generate additional card advantage and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively build up a board presence with efficient creatures and pump spells, allowing it to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Utilizing cards like Rancor, Savage Swipe, and Hunger of the Howlpack, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and deal damage quickly. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Skarrgan Pit-Skulk, Nettle Sentinel, and Burning-Tree Emissary, this deck can swarm the battlefield and capitalize on its aggressive strategy to secure a win.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Rift Bolt, and Lava Spike. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage spells and creatures like Thermo-Alchemist and Ghitu Lavarunner. The strategy is to control the board early while chipping away at the opponent's life total, eventually finishing them off with powerful burn spells like Fireblast and Chain Lightning. By maintaining pressure and conserving resources, the deck aims to secure a swift victory through aggressive tactics.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Spellstutter Sprite, supported by removal spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's board. Card draw provided by Mulldrifter and Brainstorm helps maintain consistency, while recursion from Archaeomancer and Ephemerate ensures value is maximized. The mana base is streamlined with efficient land-fetching spells and mana-fixing cards like Arcum's Astrolabe. Counterspells like Counterspell and Dispel are included to protect key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and sweepers like Pestilence. It also utilizes creatures with enter the battlefield effects to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and recursive threats to outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. Additionally, the deck includes ways to protect itself from damage with cards like Prismatic Strands. Finally, it aims to maintain card advantage through cards like Thraben Inspector and Palace Sentinels.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures and pump spells. The deck aims to quickly build up a strong board presence and deal damage quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The key strategy revolves around playing efficient creatures like Skarrgan Pit-Skulk and Nettle Sentinel, while using pump spells like Rancor and Vines of Vastwood to boost their power and push through damage. The deck also includes some evasion creatures like Silhana Ledgewalker to ensure consistent damage output.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure through efficient creatures and pump spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Nettle Sentinel and Burning-Tree Emissary, along with pump spells like Rancor and Hunger of the Howlpack, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents early on. With access to removal spells like Savage Swipe and protection spells like Vines of Vastwood, the deck can maintain board control while pushing for damage. The inclusion of evasion creatures like Silhana Ledgewalker and Vault Skirge helps ensure consistent damage output against opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and counterspells to control the board while generating value through card draw and recursion. By utilizing cheap spells and creatures with enter the battlefield effects, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and maintain board presence to secure victory. With a balance of removal, card advantage, and disruption, this deck aims to keep opponents on the back foot while deploying threats and maintaining a steady stream of resources to outlast opponents in a grindy matchup.

Utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to control the board while applying consistent pressure on the opponent. By leveraging cards like Skred, Lightning Bolt, and Counterspell, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. The inclusion of Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer provides card advantage and recursion, allowing the deck to outvalue opponents in the mid to late game. With a solid mana base and card draw spells, this deck can maintain a steady tempo and outmaneuver opponents with its versatile toolkit.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing opponents by utilizing the Urzatron lands to generate large amounts of mana. The deck includes various ways to draw cards, interact with the opponent's board, and recur key spells with cards like Mnemonic Wall and Archaeomancer. Stonehorn Dignitary is used to lock opponents out of combat, while Dinrova Horror can bounce problematic permanents. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and grind out victories through value and control strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using an Affinity archetype. By deploying cheap artifacts like Frogmite and Myr Enforcer, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and use cards like Galvanic Blast and Temur Battle Rage to deal heavy damage to the opponent. Thoughtcast and Prophetic Prism provide card draw to keep the pressure on. Atog serves as a versatile threat that can grow in power by sacrificing artifacts. Overall, the deck focuses on leveraging the synergy between artifacts to create a potent aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap removal spells and efficient creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging cards like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ephemerate to find answers and maintain card advantage, while also applying pressure with creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Mulldrifter, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of countermagic like Dispel and Counterspell provides additional protection and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to various situations and strategies.

The main focus of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with small, efficient creatures and pump spells. By aggressively attacking the opponent with creatures like Skarrgan Pit-Skulk and River Boa, and enhancing them with spells like Rancor and Elephant Guide, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Quirion Ranger and Nettle Sentinel allow for extra flexibility and mana efficiency, while cards like Savage Swipe and Vines of Vastwood provide removal and protection for key creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through counterspells and removal while also generating value with creatures like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer. Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher provide early aggression while also providing additional value when bouncing back artifacts like Arcum's Astrolabe. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage and tempo with bounce creatures and card draw. The inclusion of snow lands and Astrolabe also helps with mana fixing and card draw.
